exam.question: Philosophers believe that desire, hatred and envy are “negative emotions” which ______ the mind and lead it into a pursuit of power and possessions.

answer.explain: distort： 扭曲。句意： 哲学家们相信欲望、 仇恨和嫉妒是使人心灵扭曲并追求权力和财富的消极情感。reinforce： 加强； exert： 尽力； scramble： 攀登。

sentences.sContent: Tall buildings can distort radio signals.
sentences.sCn: 高大的建筑物会使无线电信号失真。

sentences.sContent: ...but we should not allow these extreme cases to distort our view of most young people...

remMethod.val: dis(分开) ＋ tort(卷缠) → 扭曲； 使变形

words.tran: 变形；[物] 失真；扭曲；曲解
扭曲（distortasd的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to change the appearance, sound, or shape of something so that it is strange or unclear
to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct
